notes: Defines in-scope and out-of-scope boundaries for Phase-O implementation.
Defines mandatory, ordered steps for Phase-O implementation.
Phase-O implementation checklist; execution and autonomy remain prohibited.
Phase-O preparation formally authorized and finalized. No execution, autonomy, or activation enabled.
Phase-O formally closed. System remains non-executable and non-autonomous.
Phase-P entered. Code may be written but must remain non-executable; execution, autonomy, and activation are prohibited.
Inert plan object schema module. No execution, autonomy, activation, or scheduling logic present.
Pure plan serialization/deserialization utilities. No execution, autonomy, activation, or scheduling logic present.
Pure plan validation module enforcing structural and governance invariants. Fail-closed; no execution, autonomy, or activation logic.

name: Controlled Enablement Semantics
notes: Phase-R closed after completion of design-only enablement semantics.

name: Controlled Activation Semantics
notes: Phase-S closed after completion of design-only activation semantics.

name: Temporal Authority & Tick Budgeting
notes: Phase-T closed after completion of design-only temporal semantics.

name: Agent Self-Continuation Authority
notes: Phase-U closed after completion of design-only self-continuation semantics.

name: Goal Authority & Persistence
notes: Phase-V closed after completion of design-only goal authority and persistence semantics.

name: Safety-Bound Planning Loop (ARP)
notes: Phase-W closed after completion of design-only safety-bound planning semantics.

name: Emergency Halt & Override Semantics
notes: Phase-X closed after completion of design-only emergency halt semantics.

name: Autonomy Policy & Mediation Layer
notes: Phase-Y closed after completion of design-only autonomy policy and mediation semantics.

name: SMP Canonicalization
notes: Canonical Structured Memory Packet (SMP) schema and invariants defined; design-only; no runtime effects; Phase-Z remains closed. Provenance mandatory; privation compatibility required.

name: Memory & Knowledge Safety
notes: Read-only UWM; provenance-gated; role-scoped; non-autonomous; design-only rollout.

name: Privation & Negative Knowledge (I2 Line)
notes: Privation-dominant, fail-closed, non-autonomous; negative knowledge precedes provenance/role/read/planning.

name: Planning Substrate (Non-Executable)
notes: Inert plans; validation-only; deny-by-default; no scheduling, continuation, or state change.

name: External Boundary Governance
notes: External systems untrusted; intake-only; privation + provenance + memory safety gating; no execution or planning influence.

name: Phase-2 Audit & Closure
notes: Phase-2 closed; safe-to-halt; non-autonomous; deny-by-default; progression requires new governance authorization.

name: Derived Policy Compiler Charter
notes: Governs if/how normative Markdown policies may be deterministically derived; Markdown remains sole normative authority; no executable, runtime, or authorizing artifacts permitted; mismatch or ambiguity resolves to deny + audit.

name: Deterministic Policy IR Definition
notes: Defines the shape of a deterministic, declarative, non-executable Policy IR; Markdown remains the sole normative authority; IR is subordinate, read-only, discardable; no runtime consumption, execution, or authorization permitted; mismatch or ambiguity resolves to deny + audit.

name: Proof-of-Equivalence Framework
notes: Defines how structural equivalence between Markdown governance and derived Policy IR would be demonstrated; proof is non-authorizing and non-executable; Markdown remains sole normative authority regardless of proof status; any mismatch, omission, or ambiguity resolves to deny + audit.

name: Authorization Semantics
notes: Defines how authorization would be structured if ever allowed; no authorization objects exist; no execution or autonomy enabled; revocation supremacy preserved; Phase-Z remains closed.

name: Execution Envelopes (Design-Only)
notes: Defines design-only envelope shape, bounding, metering, halt supremacy, lifecycle, failure handling, and non-existence; no envelopes are instantiated or authorized; Phase-Z remains closed.

name: Execution Envelopes — Closure Declaration
notes: Phase-5 defines execution bounding semantics only; no execution envelopes exist or are instantiated; execution, autonomy, ticks, and persistence remain prohibited; deny-by-default with ambiguity resolved to deny plus audit; Phase-Z remains CLOSED_DESIGN_ONLY.

name: Triune Revalidation & Recursion Re-Permission Doctrine
notes: Completes Phase-6 safety lattice; triune revalidation defines what must always be, what must never be, and how recovery is permitted after Phase-6.4 termination and Phase-6.5 axiom-first repair; recursion only re-permitted in principle with no execution, autonomy, or runtime reconstitution enabled.

name: Autonomy Substrate — Safety, Repair, and Revalidation Closure
notes: Phase-6 closed. Safety lattice complete: 6.4 absolute halt/teardown/destruction with sealed forensic snapshots; 6.5 axiom-first repair doctrine; 6.6 triune revalidation restoring epistemic legitimacy and re-permitting recursion in principle only. No runtime operation enabled.

name: Reconstitution & Guarded Runtime Operations
notes: Phase-7 entered. Focus: reconstitution under governance, bounded runtime operation, and deliberate stress-testing of guardrails established in Phases 1–6. Execution remains constrained; any catastrophic failure must re-trigger Phase-6.4–6.6.

name: Phase-7 Meaning Addendum
notes: Governance-binding meaning layer for Phase-7; enforces truth over continuation, halt supremacy, deny-by-default posture, and moral humility; constrains all Phase-7 technical/public derivatives; non-operational and non-authorizing.

name: Phase-7 vs Phase-6 Consistency Audit
notes: Confirms Phase-7 Meaning Addendum introduces no contradictions or bypasses relative to Phase-6 guarantees (6.4–6.6); non-executable, append-only, and authority DENY.

name: Phase-7 Structured Entry & Final Pre-Autonomy Boundary
notes: Structures Phase-7 as the final development phase prior to any autonomous agent deployment; autonomy requires a new explicit phase and authorization beyond Phase-7; no execution, autonomy, or activation enabled.
